snippet: Two days after Muhammad Tahir-ul Qadri swept into the capital with supporters, Pakistan’s government mocked him and hinted about an operation to dislodge him.
abstract: Pakistani officials mock political demands of charismatic preacher Muhammad Tahir-ul Qadri and hint at operation to dislodge him, two days after Qadri swept into capital Islamabad surrounded by thousands of supporters, calling for government to resign.
lead_paragraph: Two days after Muhammad Tahir-ul Qadri swept into the capital with supporters, Pakistan’s government mocked him and hinted about an operation to dislodge him.

headline.seo: Pakistan Rejects Preacher’s Politics and Says He Is at Risk
headline.main: Pakistan Says Preacher and Crowd at Risk
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Says Preacher and Crowd at Risk
